resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
<a style="color: #000000;" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Maurras" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Charles Maurras<span style="color: #000000;"> (1868-1952)
<span style="color: #000000;">He was a member of <em style="color: #000000;">L’Action Française<span style="color: #000000;">. He advocated anti-semitism, anti-parliamentary system, the return to a hereditary Monarchy and promoted xenophobic ideas. His collaboration with the Vichy Regime led him his arrest and degradation at the Liberation.
resource.chars:
Charles Maurras (1868-1952)

He was a member of L’Action Française. He advocated anti-semitism, anti-parliamentary system, the return to a hereditary Monarchy and promoted xenophobic ideas. His collaboration with the Vichy Regime led him his arrest and degradation at the Liberation.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The magazine, directed by Charles Maurras, was the official body to disseminate the ideas of L’Action Française.
resource.chars: The magazine, directed by Charles Maurras, was the official body to disseminate the ideas of L’Action Française.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Founded in 1898 by Henri Vaugeois and Maurice Pujo, L’Action Française was a school of thought following "anti-dreyfusard" and republican nationalism. It strongly participated in the rise of nationalism before and especially after the First World War. The movement was dissolved after the Liberation because of its collaboration with the Vichy Regime.
resource.chars: Founded in 1898 by Henri Vaugeois and Maurice Pujo, L’Action Française was a school of thought following "anti-dreyfusard" and republican nationalism. It strongly participated in the rise of nationalism before and especially after the First World War. The movement was dissolved after the Liberation because of its collaboration with the Vichy Regime.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: General Mercier was Minister of War when the A. Dreyfus Affair occurred. He helped to rig the trial, brought false documents to the Council of War. Until A. Dreyfus was released, he kept on defending the Captains’ guilt.
resource.chars: General Mercier was Minister of War when the A. Dreyfus Affair occurred. He helped to rig the trial, brought false documents to the Council of War. Until A. Dreyfus was released, he kept on defending the Captains’ guilt.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armand_du_Paty_de_Clam" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Colonel Paty de Clam (1853-1916)
He was responsible for the preliminary inquiry of the Affair. He put pressure on Alfred Dreyfus  to force him to give in. But A. Dreyfus never gave in. He didn't stop to proclaim his innocence.
resource.chars:
Colonel Paty de Clam (1853-1916)

He was responsible for the preliminary inquiry of the Affair. He put pressure on Alfred Dreyfus  to force him to give in. But A. Dreyfus never gave in. He didn't stop to proclaim his innocence.
